abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Peter Tucci organizes exhibition From Waterloo to New Jersey: The Bicentennial of King Joseph Bonaparte’s Escape to America, first major American display of relics owned by Napoleon's older brother; show, opening at Pennington School in New Jersey, includes documents, furniture, coins and other materials recovered from homes King Joseph built on Bordentown City riverfront property called Point Breeze.
lead_paragraph: This exhibition is the first major American display of artifacts that belonged to Napoleon Bonaparte’s older brother, the former king of Spain and Naples.

headline.main: ‘From Waterloo to New Jersey,’ a Glimpse of Joseph Bonaparte’s Life in Exile

snippet: This exhibition is the first major American display of artifacts that belonged to Napoleon Bonaparte’s older brother, the former king of Spain and Naples.
